lines:
Tri State College

Alek

(ACCREDITED)

Kek

L. M. SNIFF, A. M., PRESIDENT

PRESIDENT'S OFFICE

ANGOLA, INDIANA June 13, 1912

Prin. Alfred E. Stearns

Andover, Mass.

Dear Sir:

Mr. Luk has conducted himself as a gentleman in this 
institution and is doing good work. I am enclosing you copies of 
statements made by four of his teachers which will give you some 
idea of his work.

We have students from eight foreign countries and I can 
say as a rule they are better mannered than the Americans.

Very truly,
raw: Tri State College Alek (ACCREDITED) Kek L. M. SNIFF, A. M., PRESIDENT PRESIDENT'S OFFICE ANGOLA, INDIANA June 13, 1912 Prin. Alfred E. Stearns Andover, Mass. Dear Sir: Mr. Luk has conducted himself as a gentleman in this institution and is doing good work. I am enclosing you copies of statements made by four of his teachers which will give you some idea of his work. We have students from eight foreign countries and I can say as a rule they are better mannered than the Americans. Very truly,

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter commending S.C. Luk's good work and conduct, with enclosures from four teachers attesting to same (W.O. Bailey, Secretary; L.W. Fairfield, Vice-President; C.C. Sherrard, Dean, Dept. of Chemistry; E.S. Schuman, teacher of Physics and Mechanical Drawing)
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
